body:
This is a nice idea - I like the name `description`

To implement we probably need to ask the user for the description at the point they make the remote.

Do you want to have a go at this?

> This is a nice idea - I like the name `description`
> 
> To implement we probably need to ask the user for the description at the point they make the remote.

I think it should be shoved under advanced (the last thing before confirming). Thoughs/do you agree?

> Do you want to have a go at this?

Suuureee.. I'll assign myself, but as with the previous time, can't promise anything.

@jtagcat wrote
>  I might throw this under hacktoberfest.
Go for it!

> Talking about backlog, I did some stats. Tab count (backlog, net total compared to the previous hour online) (around ¼-⅓ of the actual measure):

Nice stats! I don't know what they are measuring - can you explain more?
..I still didn't get the answer to: `I think it should be shoved under advanced (the last thing before confirming). Thoughs/do you agree?`

> ..I still didn't get the answer to: `I think it should be shoved under advanced (the last thing before confirming). Thoughs/do you agree?`

That sounds reasonable :-)

issue.title: backend: adding description option to all backend filesystems

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [ ] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

Attempting to add the feature as discussed in [this issue](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4391).

A piece I could be missing, but I'm unsure of how it's used, is adding documentation to each of the markdown files for the backends for `--description` or `--s3-description` [here for s3](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blame/5ce3019fc1b64fccfce3aef7e25be97ee453fca2/docs/content/s3.md#L1823), and this would apply to each of the backends.

If I'm missing tests, please let me know. It wasn't clear to me that the backends test that each of the options exist.

Thank you!

body: Hello everyone! My name is Paul and I am just starting my GitHub activity. I'm looking for my first issues to fix and found this one as it is labeled as 'good first' one. Is there anybody assigned to it now? If not, can I be assigned for it and try to fix it, providing it is suitable for beginners?

There is nobody assigned, and it's probably suitable. I haven't worked on it.

I would start by looking at stuff interacting with configs. Description (I assume) is only shown in commands interacting purely with config, and not elsewhere. Look at how the config is created (can be through cli commands or interactively exists) and reading/showing the field (`$ rclone config` without doing anything). There is most likely a generic remote configuration holder. (the key-value what holds remote name, etc; non-generic: (sftp) host, (sftp) username)

Make sure you have a command to set-get the description programatically. If you have the time, maybe add an option to `$ rclone listremotes` to also print descriptions.

When stuck, I think you can ping ncw, who helped me out, including some of my first Go steps. Check README if they are still the person to ask help from.
Definitely have a look at https://github.com/rclone/rclone/pull/6019, as it is probably usable with very few minor changes.
Thank you so much for your feedback! I guess, I will be able to start working on it soon.

body: Can I get some feedback about my PR?
